data.chText: （移动的）速度；步速
data.enText: the speed at which sb/sth walks, runs or moves

data.chText: 以稳定的 / 徐缓的 / 悠闲的步子出发
data.enText: to set off at a steady/gentle/leisurely pace

data.chText: 交通阻塞经常把车流的速度降低得如步行一般缓慢。
data.enText: Congestion frequently reduces traffic to walking pace .

data.chText: 随着球向山下滚动，它的速度越来越快。
data.enText: The ball gathered pace as it rolled down the hill.

data.chText: 赛跑者明显加快了脚步。
data.enText: The runners have noticeably quickened their pace.

data.chText: 发生的速度；步伐；节奏
data.enText: the speed at which sth happens

data.chText: 跟上迅速的变化是很困难的。
data.enText: It is difficult to keep up with the rapid pace of change.

data.chText: 我们鼓励学生都按自己的节奏学习。
data.enText: We encourage all students to work at their own pace (= as fast or as slow as they can) .

data.chText: 我喜爱乡间那悠闲的生活节奏。
data.enText: I prefer the relaxed pace of life in the country.

data.chText: 腐化堕落的传闻日益增多。
data.enText: Rumours of corruption and scandal gathered pace (= increased in number) .

data.chText: （走或跑时）迈出的一步，一步的距离；步幅
data.enText: an act of stepping once when walking or running; the distance travelled when doing this

data.chText: 她向前走了两步。
data.enText: She took two paces forward.

data.chText: 迅速出现（或变化等）；快节奏
data.enText: the fact of sth happening, changing, etc. quickly

data.chText: 他辞去了广告业的工作，因为他承受不了那种快节奏。
data.enText: He gave up his job in advertising because he couldn't stand the pace .

data.chText: 这部小说缺乏节奏感。
data.enText: The novel lacks pace (= it develops too slowly) .
go through your paces
show your paces

data.chText: 展示自己的能力
data.enText: to perform a particular activity in order to show other people what you are capable of doing
keep pace (with sb/sth)

data.chText: （与…）并驾齐驱；（与…）步调一致
data.enText: to move, increase, change, etc. at the same speed as sb/sth

data.chText: 他大步走开了，她感到很难跟上他。
data.enText: She found it hard to keep pace with him as he strode off.

data.chText: 到目前为止，工资的增长与通货膨胀始终保持同步。
data.enText: Until now, wage increases have always kept pace with inflation.
off the pace

data.chText: （赛跑或比赛中）在领头人之后，在领头队之后
data.enText: behind the leader or the leading group in a race or a competition

data.chText: 泰格∙伍兹仍落后领先选手三杆。
data.enText: Tiger Woods is still three shots off the pace (= in golf ) .
put sb/sth through their/its paces

data.chText: 考察，考验（某人的能力）
data.enText: to give sb/sth a number of tasks to perform in order to see what they are capable of doing
set the pace

data.chText: 确定速度；确立标准；领先
data.enText: to do sth at a particular speed or to a particular standard so that other people are then forced to copy it if they want to be successful

data.chText: 这家公司再也不能在国内计算机市场上独领风骚了。
data.enText: The company is no longer setting the pace in the home computer market.

data.chText: 领跑
data.enText: to run faster than the other people taking part, at a speed that they then try to copy
force the pace

data.chText: 迫使（赛跑对手）加速
data.enText: to run very fast in a race in order to make the other people taking part run faster

data.chText: 迫使（某人）加快速度
data.enText: to make sb do sth faster than they want to

data.chText: 示威成功地促使改革进程加快。
data.enText: The demonstrations have succeeded in forcing the pace of change.
at a snail's pace

data.chText: 非常缓慢
data.enText: very slowly

data.chText: 来回踱步；走来走去
data.enText: to walk up and down in a small area many times, especially because you are feeling nervous or angry

data.chText: 她在屋子外面来回走着。
data.enText: She paced up and down outside the room.

data.chText: 特德焦躁地在屋里走来走去。
data.enText: Ted paced the floor restlessly.

data.chText: 确定速度；调整节奏
data.enText: to set the speed at which sth happens or develops

data.chText: 他巧妙地控制着自己的比赛节奏。
data.enText: He paced his game skilfully.

data.chText: 调整自己的工作（或活动）节奏
data.enText: to find the right speed or rhythm for your work or an activity so that you have enough energy to do what you have to do

data.chText: 他必须学会使自己适应这项工作的节奏。
data.enText: He'll have to learn to pace himself in this job.
pace sth↔off/out

data.chText: 以步丈量
data.enText: to measure the size of sth by walking across it with regular steps

data.chText: （用于人名前，委婉提出不同意见）请…原谅
data.enText: used before a person's name to express polite disagreement with what they have said

data.chText: 请琼斯教授原谅，证据表明…
data.enText: The evidence suggests, pace Professor Jones, that… (= Professor Jones has a different opinion) .

word_means: 迈出的一步，一步的距离

means: (走或跑时)迈出的一步，一步的距离
调整自己的工作(或活动)节奏
(用于人名前，委婉提出不同意见)请…原谅

ex.chText: 火车疾驶而过。
ex.enText: The train went by at high speed.

ex.chText: 这架新飞机的时速可以达到900公里。
ex.enText: This new plane can reach a speed of 900 kilometres an hour.

ex.chText: 我们必须加快送货速度。
ex.enText: We had to increase the speed of delivery.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指交通工具等运动的速率或事情发生的速度。

ex.chText: 他加快了步伐。
ex.enText: He quickened his pace.

ex.chText: 变革的步伐在加速。
ex.enText: The pace of change has accelerated.

ex.chText: 在当今世界，人类进步一日千里。
ex.enText: In the world today, mankind is progressing at a tremendous pace.

synonyms.bx: 指人步行的速度，常引申为生活、变化等的速度。

ex.chText: 他的钱用得很快，速度惊人。
ex.enText: His money was running out at an alarming rate/speed.

ex.chText: 经济增长速度放缓了。
ex.enText: The rate/speed of economic growth has slowed down.

synonyms.bx: 常指某事在一段时间内发生的速度，可与 speed 换用。

ex.chText: 喷气机正在以音速飞行。
ex.enText: The jet plane is flying at the velocity of sound.

ex.chText: 要求学生计算出光的速度。
ex.enText: The students were asked to calculate the velocity of light.

ex.chText: 豹子跑起来速度惊人。
ex.enText: Leopards can move with an astonishing velocity.

synonyms.bx: 物理学术语，指物体沿着一定方向运动时的速度；作普通意义上的速度解时，则指高速。

ex.chText: 我们骑马还是步行?
ex.enText: Shall we ride or walk?

ex.chText: 她一直走到这条小路的尽头。
ex.enText: She walked as far as the end of the path.

ex.chText: 那个男孩告诉我应该往东走。
ex.enText: The boy told me that I should walk eastward.

synonyms.bx: 指行走的最普通用词，通常后接副词或介词。

ex.chText: 我发现他在办公室里踱来踱去。
ex.enText: I found him pacing in his office.

ex.chText: 经理在屋子里来回踱步，试图找出解决问题的办法。
ex.enText: The manager paced the floor as he tried to find a solution to the problem.

ex.chText: 老虎在笼子里走来走去。
ex.enText: The tiger paced in its cage.

synonyms.bx: 尤指因紧张、担忧、不耐烦等而来回踱步。

ex.chText: 可怜的老妇人吃力地走着，几乎都抬不动脚了。
ex.enText: The poor old woman plodded along, hardly able to lift each foot.

ex.chText: 约翰继续艰难跋涉。
ex.enText: John kept plodding on.

ex.chText: 我们不得不迈着疲倦的步子继续登山。
ex.enText: We had to plod wearily on up the hill.

synonyms.bx: 指脚步缓慢、步履艰难地行走。

ex.chText: 他蹒跚地向大门走去，伤口流着血。
ex.enText: He staggered to the gate, bleeding from his wounds.

ex.chText: 那个醉鬼摇摇晃晃地往家走去。
ex.enText: The drunken man staggered home.

ex.chText: 他摇摇晃晃地站起来。
ex.enText: He staggered to his feet.

synonyms.bx: 通常指因虚弱、负重、醉酒等而导致身体失去平衡或行走失态，强调不稳定性和失控性。

ex.chText: 她转身迈着大步走了。
ex.enText: She turned and strode off.

ex.chText: 他大踏步地向他的车走去。
ex.enText: He strode towards his car.

ex.chText: 他拔腿往回走，步子又大又快。
ex.enText: He started back, striding swiftly.

synonyms.bx: 强调步子大而有力，往往伴有或显露出匆忙、自傲、精力充沛等状态。

ex.chText: 她的宝宝刚会走道儿。
ex.enText: Her baby has just learned to toddle.

ex.chText: 我两岁的儿子摇摇摆摆地走进卧室。
ex.enText: My two-year-old son toddled into the bedroom.

synonyms.bx: 特指幼儿因学步而摇摇晃晃地小步行走。

ex.chText: 那位老人摇摇晃晃地好不容易回到了座位上。
ex.enText: The old man managed to totter back to his seat.

ex.chText: 幼儿和老人走路蹒跚。
ex.enText: Babies and aged men totter as they walk.

ex.chText: 他拄着双拐蹒跚而行，来到国王的面前。
ex.enText: With the help of two crutches, he tottered into the King's presence.

synonyms.bx: 指尤因醉酒或患病而摇摇晃晃、跌跌撞撞地行走，好像要跌倒似的。

ex.zh: 前所未有的节奏（或步伐）

data.enText: go through your paces
show your paces

data.chText: 展示自己的能力
data.enText: to perform a particular activity in order to show other people what you are capable of doing
keep pace (with sb/sth)

data.chText: （与…）并驾齐驱；（与…）步调一致
data.enText: to move, increase, change, etc. at the same speed as sb/sth

data.chText: 他大步走开了，她感到很难跟上他。
data.enText: She found it hard to keep pace with him as he strode off.

data.chText: 到目前为止，工资的增长与通货膨胀始终保持同步。
data.enText: Until now, wage increases have always kept pace with inflation.

data.chText: （赛跑或比赛中）在领头人之后，在领头队之后
data.enText: behind the leader or the leading group in a race or a competition

data.chText: 泰格∙伍兹仍落后领先选手三杆。
data.enText: Tiger Woods is still three shots off the pace (= in golf ) .
put sb/sth through their/its paces

data.chText: 考察，考验（某人的能力）
data.enText: to give sb/sth a number of tasks to perform in order to see what they are capable of doing
set the pace

data.chText: 确定速度；确立标准；领先
data.enText: to do sth at a particular speed or to a particular standard so that other people are then forced to copy it if they want to be successful

data.chText: 这家公司再也不能在国内计算机市场上独领风骚了。
data.enText: The company is no longer setting the pace in the home computer market.

data.chText: 领跑
data.enText: to run faster than the other people taking part, at a speed that they then try to copy
force the pace

data.chText: 迫使（赛跑对手）加速
data.enText: to run very fast in a race in order to make the other people taking part run faster

data.chText: 迫使（某人）加快速度
data.enText: to make sb do sth faster than they want to

data.chText: 示威成功地促使改革进程加快。
data.enText: The demonstrations have succeeded in forcing the pace of change.
at a snail's pace

data.chText: 非常缓慢
data.enText: very slowly
pace sth↔off/out

data.chText: 以步丈量
data.enText: to measure the size of sth by walking across it with regular steps

tr: a step in walking or running
the relative speed of progress or change
example: he lived at a fast pace
he works at a great rate

tr: a unit of length equal to 3 feet
originally taken to be the average length of a stride
the distance covered by a step
example: he stepped off ten paces from the old tree and began to dig

tr: the rate of moving (especially walking or running)
the rate of some repeating event
regulate or set the pace of
walk with slow or fast paces
example: He paced up and down the hall

value.def: The pace of something is the speed at which it happens or is done.

example.ex: Many people were not satisfied with the pace of change.
example.tran: 很多人对变革的步伐不满意。

example.ex: ...people who prefer to live at a slower pace...
example.tran: 乐于放慢生活节奏的人

example.ex: They could not stand the pace or the workload...
example.tran: 他们无法忍受那种节奏和工作负荷。

example.ex: Interest rates would come down as the recovery gathered pace.
example.tran: 随着复苏的加速，利率会降下来。

value.def: Your pace is the speed at which you walk.

example.ex: He moved at a brisk pace down the rue St Antoine...
example.tran: 他沿着圣安托万街轻快地走去。

example.ex: Their pace quickened as they approached their cars.
example.tran: 走近自己的车时，他们加快了脚步。

value.def: A pace is the distance that you move when you take one step.

example.ex: He'd only gone a few paces before he stopped again...
example.tran: 他只走了几步远就又停了下来。

example.ex: I took a pace backwards.
example.tran: 我往后退了一步。

value.def: If you pace a small area, you keep walking up and down it, because you are anxious or impatient.

example.ex: As they waited, Kravis paced the room nervously...
example.tran: 他们等的时候，克拉维斯在屋里不安地踱来踱去。

example.ex: He found John pacing around the flat, unable to sleep...
example.tran: 他发现约翰在公寓里来回踱步，无法入睡。

example.ex: She stared as he paced and yelled.
example.tran: 他来回走着，咆哮着，她目不转睛地看着。

value.tran: （由于焦虑或不耐烦而）在…踱步

value.def: If you pace yourself when doing something, you do it at a steady rate.

example.ex: It was a tough race and I had to pace myself.
example.tran: 这是场艰苦的比赛，我不得不控制好节奏。

value.def: If something keeps pace with something else that is changing, it changes quickly in response to it.

example.ex: Farmers are angry because the rise fails to keep pace with inflation.
example.tran: 农民们很气愤，因为提价赶不上通货膨胀。

example.ex: ...a world changing far too fast for her to keep pace.
example.tran: 世界变化得太快，她跟不上

value.def: If you keep pace with someone who is walking or running, you succeed in going as fast as them, so that you remain close to them.

example.ex: With four laps to go, he kept pace with the leaders...
example.tran: 还剩4圈的时候，他紧紧咬住领先者。

example.ex: Daisy strode alongside her, breathing heavily but keeping pace.
example.tran: 黛西在她身边大步走着，大口喘着气，但是没有落后。

value.tran: 与…齐头并进（或并驾齐驱）

value.def: If you do something at your own pace , you do it at a speed that is comfortable for you.

example.ex: The computer will give students the opportunity to learn at their own pace...
example.tran: 计算机让学生们有机会按照自己的节奏学习。

example.ex: She was going too fast so I decided to keep riding at my own pace.
example.tran: 她骑得太快了，所以我决定按自己的速度骑。

value.def: If you put someone through their paces or make them go through their paces, you get them to show you how well they can do something.

example.ex: The British coach is putting the boxers through their paces...
example.tran: 英国教练正在检验拳手们的能力。

example.ex: A group of the world's best waterskiers will be going through their paces.
example.tran: 一队世界上最优秀的滑水运动员将一展身手。

value.tran: 考查…的能力/ 展现…的才能
